Models Julia Rose, Lauren Summers and Kayla Lauren have been banned from watching baseball for the rest of their lives - for flashing during the World Series.

The trio took the opportunity to show the millions watching the high-profile game between Houston Astros and Washington Nationals at home their breasts.

Viewers spotted two of Rose, Summers and Lauren lifting their t-shirts during a break with pitcher Gerrit Cole preparing to throw.

They could be seen in the third row behind the hitter in the seventh innings during the live coverage on Fox Sports.

(Image: Youtube)

(Image: its_juliarose/Instagram)

Rose, 25, was the first to come clean to the offence on Twitter as she wrote: "Guilty as charged."

Before she added "Whoops. The wind blew my top up." and "My lil nips made it #worldseries."

Summers, 24, quickly followed suit by owning up on her Instagram story, where she admitted: "We did it guys".

(Image: heylaurensummer/Instagram)

(Image: heylaurensummer/Instagram)

She then revealed that Lauren was also a member of the flashing three, Kayla Lauren, and @JuliaRose_33 flashed our boobies at the #WorldSeries for breast cancer."

Lauren then posted a picture from inside the ground's jail and said: "Just got kicked out of the World Series. In police HQ bathroom still gotta get that birthday selfie."

But their high jinx soon moved from harmless fun slightly more serious - as they quickly received a letter, apparently from vice president of "Security and Ballpark Operations" for the "Office of the Commissioner" David L Thomas.

(Image: its_juliarose/Instagram)

It read: "On October 27, 2019, you attended World Series Game 5 at Nationals Park in Washington DC.

"During the game you violated the fan code of conduct by exposing yourself during the 7th inning, in order to promote a business.

"You were also part of a scheme in which you induced others to expose themselves to promote their business.

"You are hereby banned from all Major League Baseball stadiums and facilities, indefinitely."

They were also ejected from Nationals Park in Washington DC.

Rose, who has 2.8 million followers on Instagram, is the founder of adult magazine SHAGMAG, which the other two model for.

Fellow culprit Summer has 1.5million followers and also works for Playboy.

Houston managed to put the flashers out of their mind as they secured a 7-1 victory and took a 3-2 lead in the World Series.
